text.words: Cast of Characters

Detective Ace,
a smart detective

Carmen Starr,
a beautiful actress

Bob,
a stylish costumer

Bonnie,
a sneezing supporting
actress

Barney,
a grumpy cameraman

Scene 1: Detective Ace's
office. He is working on the
Case of the Bottle Bandit,
someone who steals bottles of
expensive perfume. The
phone rings.
ACE: Hello?

VOICE: Ace! Ace! Come
quick! He's gone!

ACE: Who's gone? Come
where?

VOICE: To the movie set.
Manny's missing!

wordInfo.text:
A play is divided into scenes. During a scene, there
is no change in time or
location.

Describes something that costs a lot
of money, like perfume.

A liquid used to give people or things
a good scent.

text.words:
Scene 2: The set of a pirate
movie. Detective Ace enters.

CARMEN: I'm so glad you're
here. It's just terrible. My own
costar—missing! Maybe I'll be
next.

ACE: So Manny is your costar.
Can you describe him for me,
Miss—?

CARMEN: Carmen. Carmen
Starr. Well, he has nice green
eyes, a loud voice, and stands
about 2 feet tall.
Ace looks surprised.

CARMEN: Oh, I didn't tell you?
He's a parrot.

wordInfo.text:
A play is divided into scenes. During a
scene, there is no change in time or
location.

Actors or actresses who share the two
main roles. If there are two main
characters in a movie, they are
costars.

text.words:
CARMEN: He was taken last
night. The good news is the
movie camera was left on by
mistake, so we caught his
kidnapper on tape.
ACE: So who did it?

CARMEN: That's the bad news.
The camera ran out when
Manny was naming his
kidnapper!

Carmen plays the film, and we
see Manny say, "I should have
known it would be you, Bah—!"

wordInfo.text:
Someone who takes a child or other
person away without permission.

text.words:
ACE: Bah, huh? Get me a list
of everybody on the set
whose name begins with the
sound  "bah." We'll find that
bird bandit!

Scene 3: Costume shop. There
are costume pieces
everywhere. Ace interviews Bob.

ACE: So, Bob, you made all the
costumes for this movie, right?

BOB: Yeah. Another pirate
movie. Big deal.
Ace raises his eyebrows.

BOB: Don't get me wrong. I love
Manny. But I hate pirate movies!
I'd do anything to make some
cool alien costumes!

wordInfo.text:
A play is divided into scenes. During a
scene, there is no change in time or
location.

text.words:
Scene 4: Bonnie's dressing
room. Bonnie, the supporting
actress, is allergic to
everything.

BONNIE: I didn't do it! Manny
and I were almost costars!
Until I found out I was...
ACHOO!

ACE: Allergic to feathers?
Seems like a good reason to
get rid of a parrot.

BONNIE: But it couldn't have
been me. I was on vacation
all week. I just got back today!

wordInfo.text:
A play is divided into scenes. During a
scene, there is no change in time or
location.

Describes a person who has a bad
reaction to something. If people are
allergic to flowers, they might sneeze
a lot.

text.words:
Scene 5: Backstage. Ace
interviews Barney, the short,
stubby cameraman.

ACE: So, Barney. Have you
always wanted to be a
cameraman?

BARNEY: No way! I wanted to be
the director, but they hired me
as a cameraman instead. They
were headed for trouble.

ACE: So for revenge you got rid
of the main character?

BARNEY: Hey! That ain't fair. It
wasn't me. Besides, why would I
have left the camera on if I was
planning to steal the bird? It just
don't make sense.

wordInfo.text:
A play is divided into scenes. During a
scene, there is no change in time or
location.

An idiom that means something bad is
going to happen because of your
decisions.

The person who is most important in a
play or story.

text.words:
Just then, Carmen walks by.
Both men nearly fall over.

BARNEY: calling out behind
her, Nice perfume, Miss Starr.

Ace laughs, and then stops.
He thinks for a minute and
then...

ACE: That's it! I know who did
it! Barney, gather everybody
together and meet me back
here in five minutes!

wordInfo.text:
A liquid used to give people or things a
good scent.

text.words:
Scene 6: Backstage, five
minutes later. Bob, Bonnie,
and Barney are nervous.
Carmen is excited.

CARMEN: So, Ace! Did you
figure out which one of these
crooks took Manny?

ACE: Yes. It wasn't Bob. Or
Bonnie. Or Barney. No,
someone else had an even
better reason to keep Manny
quiet.

The three suspects are
relieved. Carmen is confused.

CARMEN: Well, then who took
Manny?

wordInfo.text:
A play is divided into scenes. During a
scene, there is no change in time or
location.

A person that others think did
something bad, like break the law.

text.words:
ACE: You did, Miss Starr. Or
should we call you... the Bottle
Bandit?
Bob, Bonnie, and Barney gasp.

BONNIE: She's the Bottle Bandit?
The one who keeps stealing
expensive per-per-per-CHOO!
Perfumes?

Carmen tries to escape, but
they catch her first.

CARMEN: Let go! You can't do
this to me!

wordInfo.text:
To take a quick, short breath in when
you are surprised.

Describes something that costs a lot
of money, like perfume.

A liquid used to give people or things
a good scent.
To get away before someone catches you.

text.words:
ACE: I found this article about
the Bottle Bandit under Manny's
cage. He discovered her
identity, so Carmen had to get
rid of him before he told the
police.
CARMEN: You have no proof!
ACE: No?

Ace empties out Carmen's
purse, and perfume bottles and
parrot feathers fall out.

ACE: Manny wasn't saying Bob,
Bonnie, or Barney. He was
calling you the "Bottle Bandit."

wordInfo.text:
Your name or other title that describes
who you are.
Facts that show something is true.

A liquid used to give people or things
a good scent.

text.words:
BARNEY: So, Bottle Bandit,
where's the bird?

CARMEN: defeated, At the city
zoo. I told them he went crazy,
so they'd ignore everything he
said. They were happy to get a
talking parrot. I was happy to
put him behind bars.

ACE: And now, you'll be the only
one behind bars. Now that we
know where to find Manny, the
Case of the Missing Manny—
and the Bottle Bandit—is closed.

wordInfo.text:
Describes someone who has given
up.

To act like you can't see or hear
someone.

questions.question:
Why does Ace suspect Bob, Barney, and Bonnie of taking
Manny?

options.words: They each had a reason to want Manny gone.

They each needed the money they could get from selling
Manny.
They each had read the article about the Bottle Bandit.

questions.question:
When you read the play The Case of Missing Manny, what
shows you that a character is speaking?
What clues did Ace find in Carmen's purse?

options.words: a newspaper article about the Bottle Bandit
bird seed and a zoo ticket
